en: The good, the bad, and the ugly

* Paweł Fertyk
* long time coder (C++, Java, Python)
* passion for computer games
* 2018 [color=black]Miskatonic Studio[/color]
* first game: [color=blue]Intrepid[/color]

[b]Godot then:[/b]

* very small download size
* works on everything
* no lame licenses 
* pong tutorial
* manual collision detection
[color=red]* not brilliant[/color]

[b]Godot now:[/b]

* much better looking
* 3D examples
* interesting tutorial
* collisions out of the box
* great progress
[color=green]* very promising[/color]

[color=green]* mostly OK[/color]
* built-in exporter in Blender
* other exporters available
* materials created automatically
[color=#F2971A]* no support for DDS, TIFF etc.[/color]
[color=#F2971A]* small issue with saving materials[/color]
[color=green]* excellent camera animation[/color]
[color=#F2971A]* occasional scaling issue[/color]
[color=red]* very bad with Armature modifier![/color]

[color=green]* better than expected[/color]
[color=#F2971A]* 3D FPP Interaction Template[/color]
* good enough for a simple game
[color=blue]* Thread Model -> Multi-Threaded[/color]
[color=#F2971A]* no clip planes[/color]

* forward vs deferred
* limited to ~5 light sources
* use [color=blue]Area[/color] to detect unused lights
[color=green]* shadows out of the box[/color]
[color=#F2971A]* shadow artifacts[/color]
[color=#F2971A]* shadow contact issues[/color]

* uses alpha from Albedo texture
* only [color=#F2971A]8 bit/color PNG[/color]
[color=red]* whole object with alpha missing[/color]
* keep alpha objects to a minimum
* eventually used 3D human models
* eventually removed outer windows
* refraction is nice, but [color=#F2971A]unpredictable[/color]

* works out of the box
[color=#F2971A]* docs could be better[/color]
[color=green]* sky texture[/color]
* very nice sky emission
[color=red]* no sky shadows[/color]
[color=green]* beautiful glow and reflections[/color]
* auto exposure can be tricky
[color=green]* excellent DOF effect[/color]

* 4 mouse modes, very useful
* can use a custom cursor
[color=red]* doesn't work with capture mode![/color]
* had to use a TextureRect
